236.title: How shuttering USAID could impact famine, lives in Sudan
236.summary: President Trump's efforts to shutter the humanitarian agency, USAID, could have drastic impacts on places like war-torn Sudan. The stoppage could mean less medicine for the sick, fewer first responders and more famine. Warning, the images in this story are graphic.

237.summary: Palestinians and Israelis are reacting to President Trump's proposal for the U.S. to develop the Gaza Strip amid Israel's ceasefire with Hamas. While some, like Israel's defense minister, have praised Trump's proposal, many oppose the idea. CBS News' Chris Livesay has more.

238.title: Mona Lisa will have its own room after Louvre renovation, but it will cost more to see
238.summary: The renovation at the Louvre Museum in Paris will see the famed Mona Lisa moved to its own, separate space, where it will be easier to manage the crowds. However, visitors will have to purchase an extra ticket to see the work of art.

239.title: Investigation targets online groups accused of child sex abuse, torture
239.summary: Two men have been arrested for their roles in what authorities called "extremist" online communities.

240.title: Cocaine "no worse than whiskey," Colombia's president says
240.summary: Cocaine "is no worse than whiskey" and is only illegal because it comes from Latin America, said Colombian President Gustavo Petro, whose nation is the world's biggest cocaine producer and exporter.

241.title: One of Europe's most-wanted fugitives spotted at religious service
241.summary: Jos Leijdekkers — also known as "Omar Sheriff" and "Chubby Jos" — is accused of trafficking cocaine and ordering a murder.

242.title: January 2025 was hottest January on record despite factors working against it
242.summary: The world set yet another monthly heat record in January, despite an abnormally chilly U.S., a cooling La Nina​​ and predictions of a slightly less hot 2025, the European climate service Copernicus says.

243.title: Wales suffer 14th straight defeat in Six Nations loss to Italy
243.summary: Italy sent slumping Wales further into crisis on Saturday, triumphing 22-15 in front of delighted fans in Rome.  Italy showed very little of the handling errors and poor decisions which have often plagued their Six Nations performances.
243.author: NEWS WIRES

244.title: Baltics disconnect from Russian grid: Decrease ‘vulnerability to Russian blackmail’
244.summary: Three Baltic nations – Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania – disconnected from Moscow's power grid to join the EU's electricity network in an attempt to decrease their "vulnerability ... to Russian blackmail", FRANCE 24 Chief Foreign Editor Rob Parsons said in an analysis.
244.author: FRANCE24

245.title: Lebanon forms new government after two years of political stalemate
245.summary: Lebanon's President Joseph Aoun on Saturday signed a decree to form a new government after more than two years of political stalemate and a devastating war between Israel and Hezbollah. Newly elected Aoun appointed Prime Minister Nawaf Salam to head the new government after years of economic stagnation blamed on corruption and mismanagement.
245.author: NEWS WIRES

246.title: Slovakians protest PM Fico over govt pro-Russia policy shift
246.summary: Huge crowds gathered in dozens of cities and towns across Slovakia on Friday to mount vocal protests against the pro-Russian policies of populist Prime Minister Robert Fico. The latest wave of anti-government rallies was fueled by Fico’s recent trip to Moscow for talks with Russian President Vladimir Putin, a rare visit to the Kremlin by a European Union leader since Moscow’s all-out invasion of Ukraine began on Feb. 24, 2022.
246.author: FRANCE24

247.title: Baltic nations switch from Russian power grid to EU network
247.summary: The three Baltic states on Saturday cut ties with Russia's power grid to join the European Union's network, the culmination of a years-long process that gained urgency with Moscow's invasion of Ukraine. Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania – all former Soviet republics that are now in the European Union and NATO – had wanted to block Russia's ability to geopolitically blackmail them via the electricity system.
247.author: FRANCE24

248.title: Mexican avocado farmers prepare to meet Super Bowl demand surge
248.summary: Despite Donald Trump's tariff threats, Mexican farmers working flat out to meet Super Bowl fans' appetite for guacamole believe that, as long as they keep growing avocados, people will keep buying them. Mexican avocado shipments are worth more than three billion dollars a year, with consumption in the United States set to peak on Sunday when the Kansas City Chiefs will take on the Philadelphia Eagles in New Orleans in the climax of the NFL season.
248.author: FRANCE24

249.title: South Africa condemns Trump 'propaganda' after US freezes aid
249.summary: South Africa on Saturday condemned as "propaganda" claims by US President Donald Trump that a new law would enable Pretoria to expropriate land from white farmers. Trump issued an order freezing aid to South Africa over a law which came into effect in January that he alleges allows land to be seized from white farmers "without compensation".
249.author: NEWS WIRES

250.title: US judge halts Musk's DOGE access to Treasury Department data
250.summary: A US judge issued an emergency order Saturday that restricts access to Treasury Department data from Elon Musk's Department of Government Efficiency (DOGE).  Musk is leading US President Donald Trump’s federal cost-cutting efforts but ran into controversy last week amid reports his team was accessing sensitive data at the Treasury Department.
250.author: NEWS WIRES

251.title: Paris AI Summit: ‘Start of everything is transparency’, researcher says
251.summary: AI researcher and founding member of Climate Change AI Dr Sasha Luccioni spoke to FRANCE 24 about the upcoming summit on artificial intelligence in Paris and the technology’s impact on the climate. Luccioni called for more transparency and accountability from Big Tech and industry players, Luccioni said: “we should really be ... asking enough questions so we can make informed decisions without just believing that it’s the best and greatest”.
251.author: FRANCE24

252.title: Three Israeli hostages freed in prisoner swap with Hamas
252.summary: Three Israeli men, held captive in the Gaza Strip for 16 months, were released by Hamas on Saturday as part of a fragile ceasefire deal. Since the truce took effect on January 19, 16 Israeli and dual-national hostages have been freed, as have five Thais outside of the agreement.
252.author: FRANCE24

253.title: Modi’s party wins critical Delhi election for first time in almost 3 decades
253.summary: Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi's party on Saturday regained power in the nation's capital for the first time in 27 years after beating the opposition Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) in local elections.
253.author: NEWS WIRES

254.title: US states sue Trump administration over DOGE access to Treasury records
254.summary: Nineteen Democratic attorneys general sued President Donald Trump on Friday to stop Elon Musk's Department of Government Efficiency from accessing Treasury Department records that contain sensitive personal data such as Social Security and bank account numbers for millions of Americans. The case, filed in federal court in New York City, alleges the Trump administration allowed Musk's team access to the Treasury Department’s central payment system in violation of federal law.
254.author: FRANCE24

255.title: Trump cuts US aid to South Africa over land restitution law
255.summary: US President Donald Trump on Friday froze US aid to South Africa, citing a law in the country that he alleges allows farm land to be seized from white farmers, despite Johannesburg's denials. The move spurred outcry from health researchers and medical workers in the country which has the highest number of people living with HIV.
255.author: FRANCE24

256.title: 🔴 Follow live: Israel begins releasing Palestinian detainees under Gaza truce deal
256.author: FRANCE24

257.title: Paris AI summit: 'Zero signatories' from Big Tech on copyright charter
257.summary: One of the hoped outcomes of the AI summit which would be held in Paris on February 10-11 is a charter on copyright, a contentious issue that many creators have raised with the spread of AI technology, FRANCE 24 Technology Editor Peter O'Brien said. Aimed at protecting “all that work that is scraped by these artificial intelligence models from the internet before they reproduce similar stuff”, the charter is currently being signed by a number of publishers but so far, there are “zero signatories from Big Tech or AI companies”, he added.
257.author: FRANCE24

258.title: Hamas hands over Israeli hostages to Red Cross
258.summary: Hamas on Saturday handed over three Israeli captives to the Red Cross in Gaza, the fifth hostage-prisoner swap under an ongoing ceasefire with Israel. Hostages Eli Sharabi, Or Levy and Ohad Ben Ami were released after they were brought onto a stage in the central Gaza city of Deir el-Balah by masked Hamas militants. FRANCE 24's Noga Tarnopolsky reports from Hostages Square in Tel Aviv.
258.author: FRANCE24

259.title: 🔴 Follow live: Hamas hands over 3 Israeli hostages to Red Cross under Gaza truce deal
259.author: FRANCE24

260.title: Israeli medical officials prepare to receive hostages released from Gaza
260.summary: Reporting from Tel Aviv, FRANCE 24’s Noga Tarnopolsky speaks to Dr. Hagai Levine, chairman of the Israeli Association of Public Health Physicians, who also heads the medical team for the Israeli Hostages Family Forum. Dr. Levine details some of the medical preparations in place to receive the three hostages set to be released Saturday.
260.author: FRANCE24

261.title: Baltic states cut ties to Russian power grid in historic switch away from Moscow
261.summary: Estonia, Latvia and Lithuania disconnected their electricity systems from Russia's power grid on Saturday, the region's operators said, part of a plan designed to integrate the countries more closely with the EU and boost security.
261.author: NEWS WIRES

262.title: Judge blocks Trump plan to place thousands of USAID workers on leave

263.title: Live: Israel releases 183 Palestinian detainees after Hamas frees 3 hostages

263.author: FRANCE 24

264.summary: After last year's European Parliament elections, in which far-right parties performed strongly in several countries, a rally Saturday in Madrid was a meant as a show of force of the EU parliament's biggest far-right bloc. The rally adopted the slogan "Make Europe Great Again", a nod to US President Donald Trump's  "Make America Great Again".

265.title: Hamas to free 3 more Israeli hostages for dozens of Palestinian prisoners under Gaza ceasefire
265.summary: Hamas-led militants are set to free three more hostages, all Israeli civilian men, on Saturday, and Israel will release dozens of Palestinian prisoners as part of a fragile agreement that has paused the war in the Gaza Strip. FRANCE 24's Noga Tarnopolsky reports from Jerusalem.
265.author: FRANCE24

266.title: UN warns of regional escalation in DR Congo conflict ahead of the high stakes Tanzania summit
266.summary: Diplomatic efforts to achieve peace are getting underway this weekend in Tanzania. It will be the first time that Paul Kagame and Felix Tshisekedi engage in direct talks since the resurgence of the conflict. As the United Nations warned of regional escalation, the Congelese President hopes to get out of the summit an immediate ceasefire and the unconditional withdrawal of M23 group and its Rwandan allies, but it is not clear if Kigali is willing to make those concessions.
266.author: Yinka OYETADE

267.title: Israel decries ‘shocking’ images of gaunt, pale hostages freed by Hamas
267.summary: Hostages Ohad Ben Ami, Or Levy and Eli Sharabi were released from Gaza in exchange for 183 Palestinian prisoners, after more than 16 months in captivity.
267.author: Susannah George, Alon Rom, Heidi Levine, Mikhail Klimentov

268.title: Who are the Israeli hostages released in the ceasefire with Hamas?

268.author: Victoria Bisset, Annabelle Timsit, Victoria Craw

269.title: Monitoring the status of hostages still in Gaza after Hamas’s attack
269.summary: A total of 251 people were taken in the attack on Israel on Oct. 7, 2023. We’re tracking what happened to each of them.
269.author: Victoria Bisset, Júlia Ledur, Leslie Shapiro

270.title: The sorrow, hope and longing of Japan’s ‘Missing Post Office’

315.title: Is there a Trump Doctrine for Foreign Policy?
315.summary:
A lot of labels have been applied to Trump's foreign policy approach. America First, Isolationist, transactional, imperialist, protectionist. "I'm a nationalist and a globalist" he told the Wall Street Journal during his first term.

In his inaugural address last month, Trump made comments suggesting his foreign policy will be characterized by restraint, saying, in part, success should be defined by the "wars we never get into."

Yet in the same address, he also said, the United States will take back the Panama Canal.

In his first campaign, Trump ran on the idea that the cycle of the United States intervening in the Middle East should come to an end.

And on Tuesday of this week, he said that the U.S. will "take over" the Gaza Strip, after relocating the Palestinians, who live there.

Trump has promised a new approach to American foreign policy. Is there a Trump Doctrine? And what is it?

For sponsor-free episodes of Consider This, sign up for Consider This+ via Apple Podcasts or at plus.npr.org

Email us at considerthis@npr.org

316.title: The fight for a legendary shipwreck's treasure
316.summary:
The San Jose was a marvel of 17th century technology. The Spanish galleon weighed more than a thousand tons, was made of wood reinforced with iron, and featured three masts and 64 cannons. In its cargo were gold, silver, silk and porcelain. But in 1708, it sank after a battle with an English ship near what is now Colombia.

For centuries, the shipwreck was the stuff of legends, until 2015 when underwater investigators found what they believed to be the San Jose's wreckage. The treasure on board this ship could be worth billions of dollars. But who owns it? Today on the show, four groups stake their claims to the wreck of the San Jose. Those claims reveal a lot about who has a say over the bottom of the sea and how we can begin to untangle the complicated legacy of colonialism.

This episode of Planet Money was hosted by Erika Beras and Mary Childs. It was produced by Sam Yellowhorse Kesler with reporting help from Willa Rubin and edited by Keith Romer. It was fact-checked by Sierra Juarez and engineered by Neil Rauch with help from Robert Rodriguez. Alex Goldmark is Planet Money's executive producer.

390.title: How Trump could pave the way for China in Latin America
390.summary: China has begun to challenge U.S. hegemony in Latin America. The chaos of the Trump presidency may present it a new opportunity.
390.author: Kate Linthicum, Stephanie Yang

391.title: 'Shadow government'? Billionaire Elon Musk's grip on U.S. government spending raises questions
391.summary: Billionaire Elon Musk was the focus of many in Washington this week, as his Department of Government Efficiency slashed at the federal bureaucracy.
391.author: Kevin Rector

392.title: Can Elon Musk shut down a federal agency? Yes, if presidential rule replaces constitutional governance
392.summary: Musk's takeover of USAID tests the principle of constitutional rule versus presidential power.
392.author: David G. Savage

393.title: Senate panel vote clears the way for Kennedy to become health secretary
393.summary: A key Senate committee supports Robert F. Kennedy Jr., President Trump's pick to head the Department of Health and Human Services. The full Senate will vote on his nomination.
393.author: Seema Mehta, Karen Kaplan

394.title: Column: Many will lie about the consequences of Trump's tariffs. The markets won't
394.summary: When the president announced tariffs on China, Canada and Mexico, stocks tumbled, responding to economic realities that politicians and their supporters often ignore.
394.author: Jonah Goldberg

395.title: 'My home has become a cemetery.' Amid cease-fire, Gazans unearth their dead from rubble
395.summary: A Palestinian woman who lost 10 children and her husband shelters in her shattered Gaza home, where four of her youngest remain buried under rubble.
395.author: Bilal Shbair, Laura King

396.title: Businesses close, children skip school for 'a day without immigrants' protest
396.summary: Organizers said they have tracked 250 businesses nationwide that were closed Monday in solidarity with immigrants.
396.author: Andrea Castillo, Malia Mendez, Cindy Carcamo, Gustavo Arellano

397.title: ACLU sues Trump administration for shutting down asylum process at southern border
397.summary: Trump's executive order sought to dismantle asylum at the southern border. Lawyers say it has been illegally extended to migrants inside the country.
397.author: Rachel Uranga

398.title: California breathes sigh of relief with delayed tariffs on Mexico and Canada. China remains in play
398.summary: Stocks largely recover from an early tumble after Trump confirms one-month delay in imposing tariffs on Mexico. But tariffs on China remain in play.
398.author: Don Lee

399.title: Mexico and Canada reach deals with Trump, but China tariffs loom
399.summary: Mexican President Claudia Sheinbaum and Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau said Monday that their countries have avoided hefty U.S. tariffs — for now.
399.author: Kate Linthicum, Patrick J. McDonnell

400.title: Column: Trump is creating an imperial presidency — and he's doing it by decree
400.summary: Trump has been back in the White House for two weeks and is already remaking the federal government — and trying to create an imperial presidency.
400.author: Doyle McManus

401.title: English words have invaded Korea. The government is fighting back
401.summary: How do you say "deepfake," "ASAP" and "digital" in Korean? The fight to keep foreign words from diluting the language
401.author: Max Kim

402.title: Thousands rally in downtown Los Angeles, shut down 101 Freeway to protest Trump's immigration policies
402.summary: Draped in Mexican and Salvadoran flags, roughly 1,000 demonstrators gathered near City Hall shortly before noon, blocking traffic at Spring and Temple streets.
402.author: Daniel Miller, Ben Poston

403.title: Column: A president who won't tell the truth about California may unfairly punish the state
403.summary: Trump's bogus claims about his popularity in the Golden State could be laughed off if he hadn't threatened tying wildfire relief to an overhaul of the state's election system. It's both reckless and cruel.
403.author: Mark Z. Barabak

404.title: Trump cuts chaotic path in first weeks, bucking laws and norms in pursuit of promised agenda
404.summary: President Trump in his first weeks back in the White House repeatedly bucked the Constitution in pursuit of his conservative agenda. Democrats decried the ensuing "chaos."
404.author: Kevin Rector

405.title: Mexico and Canada order retaliatory tariffs on U.S. after Trump starts trade war
405.summary: President Trump announced sweeping tariffs on goods imported from Mexico, Canada and China, triggering a trade war and raising fears about consumer costs.
405.author: Kate Linthicum, Don Lee

406.title: This French film about Mexico has 13 Oscar nominations. Why 'Emilia Pérez' is tanking in Mexico
406.summary: Although it's set in Mexico City, French film 'Emilia Pérez' ran into a frost reception on its opening there. Critics cited stereotypes and the lack of a clear message about the narcos it portrays.
406.author: Patrick J. McDonnell, Cecilia Sánchez Vidal

407.title: Trump and the L.A. fires have made for nonstop news. Experts share ways to deal, not reel
407.summary: Experts said many people today feel overwhelmed by the news, but there are ways to reduce such anxiety, in part by reducing scrolling.
407.author: Kevin Rector

408.title: CDC scrubs research databases referencing sexual orientation and gender identity
408.summary: Health researchers began sharing warnings on social media several days ago, urging members of the community to make copies of federal data before the information was removed from the CDC website.
408.author: Corinne Purtill, Karen Kaplan

409.title: Rubio carries anti-immigration message to Latin America in first trip overseas as Trump's top diplomat
409.summary: Rubio has to balance aggressive Trump policies with Latin America's willingness to cooperate. The Panama Canal will be contentious.
409.author: Tracy Wilkinson

410.title: Another unwelcome consequence of climate change: An explosion of urban rats
410.summary: Global warming is worsening droughts, making sea levels rise, and fueling deadly storms. Now scientists have a new problem to add to that list: Climate change is helping rat populations thrive in U.S. cities.
410.author: Karen Kaplan

411.title: Trump's order on antisemitism and 'Hamas sympathizers' has California universities on alert
411.summary: Trump's executive order calling on campuses to address antisemitism has university leaders, faculty and students concerned as the president vows to revoke visas of pro-Palestinian international students who have taken part in protests.
411.author: Jaweed Kaleem

412.title: A fragile Gaza cease-fire holds for now, as Hamas frees eight more hostages
412.summary: Eight hostages held by Hamas militants are returned to Israel as Palestinian prisoner releases proceed — but can the Gaza cease-fire hold?
412.author: Laura King

413.title: Trump's orders have upended U.S. immigration. What legal routes remain?
413.summary: President Trump, in his first days in office, has released a series of executive orders that will reshape the country's immigration system. We lay out the key changes.
413.author: Jessica Garrison, Rebecca Plevin

414.title: As Trump cuts federal jobs, even national parks are on the chopping block
414.summary: As the Trump administration rushes to eliminate federal jobs, even the national parks — among the country's most beloved and least politicized institutions — are in the crosshairs.
414.author: Jack Dolan

415.title: A new Syrian government struggles to reset its corrupt, besieged economy
415.summary: With Syria's corruption-ridden economy in shambles after the overthrow of Bashar Assad, the caretaker government's priority is to raise cash and bring stability.
415.author: Nabih Bulos

416.title: These House newcomers came to the Capitol with big plans. Then the wildfires hit
416.summary: The California infernos were baptism by fire in Washington politics for Reps. Luz Rivas, George Whitesides and Laura Friedman.
416.author: Faith E. Pinho

417.title: Senators challenge Robert Kennedy Jr. on vaccines in confirmation hearing as health secretary
417.summary: Robert F. Kennedy Jr. faced aggressive questions about his skepticism of vaccines and other issues during the first of two scheduled Senate confirmation hearings.
417.author: Seema Mehta, Karen Kaplan

418.title: Is Trump pushing his presidential powers beyond what the Constitution allows?
418.summary: Trump is likely to succeed in expanding presidential powers on some fronts because the Constitution generally puts vast power in the hands of the president.
418.author: David G. Savage

419.title: There's a new royal baby in town: Britain's Princess Beatrice welcomes second child early
419.summary: Princess Beatrice, who is ninth in line to the British throne, has welcomed her second child with her husband, millionaire property tycoon Edoardo Mapelli Mozzi.
419.author: Nardine Saad

420.title: Column: No one polices men's bodies the way we police women's bodies
420.summary: As President Trump takes a hammer to reproductive rights, a Mississippi legislator proposes making it illegal to ejaculate without the 'intent to fertilize an embryo.'
420.author: Robin Abcarian

421.title: Column: Trump pardoned a lot of bad apples. Now he and Republicans own the barrelful
421.summary: Republicans have long styled themselves as the party of law and order and 'backing the blue,' but Trump freed people who attacked police. How does that make the country safer?
421.author: Mark Z. Barabak

422.title: Immigration arrests in churches? Some clergy say not so fast
422.summary: Churches took in refugees from battle-scarred Central America in the 1980s, a precursor to their current focus on undocumented immigrants.
422.author: Andrea Castillo

423.title: Chinese films dodging censors have no place to go. Can they crack into Taiwan?
423.summary: Taiwan is an ideal place for Chinese filmmakers to evade censorship. But the island democracy has its own restrictions on what Chinese films are allowed to air.
423.author: Stephanie Yang, Xin-yun Wu

424.title: Low math and English scores mark the nation's report card, California and L.A. included
424.summary: Scores nationwide and in California have yet to rebound from pandemic-era declines. Some outcomes continue to get worse. Low math and English scores, California and L.A. included, mark the nation's report card.
424.author: Howard Blume

425.title: Will Mexico accept military flights of deportees? President Sheinbaum deflects on sensitive issue
425.summary: The Trump administration's use of U.S. military aircraft to return deportees has raised alarms throughout Latin America.
425.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

426.title: Federal judge blocks White House freeze on 'financial assistance' amid anger, confusion
426.summary: California will help lead a coalition of states in suing to block a White House budget office order halting "all federal financial assistance."
426.author: Kevin Rector, Faith E. Pinho, Emily Alpert Reyes

427.title: Goldberg: President Trump demands GOP unity. Here's why he might not get it
427.summary: Trump has left the Republican faithful scrambling to explain and defend his actions beyond blind cult-of-personality loyalty. With the slim GOP majorities in Congress, that's not politically manageable
427.author: Jonah Goldberg

428.title: Former Second Gentleman Doug Emhoff will split time between L.A. and New York in new legal job
428.summary: Questions about former Vice President Kamala Harris' plans have swirled since she lost her presidential bid — notably about whether the former California senator and attorney general will run for governor next year.
428.author: Seema Mehta

429.title: Justice Dept. halts legal programs for detained immigrants, cuts off advocates' access to facilities
429.summary: The suspension of advocates' access to immigrant detention centers eliminates most chances for detainees without a lawyer to receive basic legal information.
429.author: Rachel Uranga

430.title: With diminished clout, Californians in Congress struggle to counter Trump's agenda
430.summary: With little power in Republican-led Washington, D.C., California Democrats struggle to mount a countereffort to President Trump's agenda.
430.author: Seema Mehta, Faith E. Pinho

431.title: Thousands of Palestinians stream back to northern Gaza as cease-fire with Israel holds
431.summary: Israeli troops pull back but maintain a watchful eye on the tens of thousands of Gazans who had been displaced during the 15 months of fighting.
431.author: Nabih Bulos

432.title: As Colombia ends its immigration standoff with Trump, Mexico looks eager to avoid a clash
432.summary: Colombia attempted to stand up to Trump's immigration demands, with mixed results. Mexico appears to be playing it safer.
432.author: Kate Linthicum, Tracy Wilkinson

433.title: Calmes: Trump's focus on retribution distracts from the nation's real domestic enemies
433.summary: The new president's enemies aren't America's enemies. If the FBI turns to retribution, what will protect us from the real threats that endanger the nation?
433.author: Jackie Calmes

434.title: Trump and Biden add to long, strange history of presidential pardons
434.summary: Trump's clemency for Jan. 6 rioters and Biden's reprieve for family represent merely the latest chapters in an odd history of the presidential pardon.
434.author: David Wharton

435.title: Is Xavier Becerra's next move running for governor? He's not saying. Yet.
435.summary: Former President Biden's secretary of Health and Human Services is strongly considering running for governor of California, according to allies.
435.author: Seema Mehta

436.title: Trump punishes Colombia for refusing entry to deportation flights
436.summary: He slaps a 25% tariff on Colombian goods and imposes a raft of visa restrictions. Latin American nations are grappling with how to deal with Trump on his signature issue.
436.author: Tracy Wilkinson

437.title: Column: The rise of Silicon Valley, from indifference to lords of the political universe
437.summary: The assembly of billionaires at Trump's inauguration was a display of wealth and power unlike any before. The display was all the more remarkable given how recently many in tech were politically naive or apathetic.
437.author: Mark Z. Barabak

438.title: Trump talks 'free speech' while moving to muzzle those he disagrees with
438.summary: President Trump issued an executive order purporting to end government censorship. Critics scoffed, saying his actions do just the opposite.
438.author: Kevin Rector

439.title: California's growing need for caregivers could collide with a crackdown on immigrants
439.summary: The Trump administration's plans to crack down on immigration and launch mass deportations could drain caregivers from the workforce as California and the country face the needs of an aging population, advocates and experts say.
439.author: Emily Alpert Reyes

440.title: Abcarian: Does Donald Trump's return to power mean it's time to admit he's right? In a word, no
440.summary: Bishop Mariann Edgar Budde's plea to Trump the day after his inauguration exemplified the principled criticism the president deserves regardless of his victory.
440.author: Robin Abcarian

441.title: Opinion: Trump promised to end the Ukraine war, but neither side is ready
441.summary: As Eisenhower once said of how conflicts end, 'sometimes it just gets down to the dirty job of killing until one side or the other cracks.'
441.author: ML Cavanaugh

442.title: Stranded in Mexico City, these migrants hoping to reach the United States have no good options
442.summary: The 1,500 migrants living in this Mexico City encampment face hard choices with President Trump in office.
442.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

443.title: Community groups set up strike teams to respond to Trump's mass deportation plans
443.summary: Community groups are dusting off the rapid-response networks they built during President Trump's first administration to prepare for immigration sweeps in California's agricultural heartland.
443.author: Rebecca Plevin

444.title: Visiting L.A. after firestorm, Trump focuses on overhauling California water policy
444.summary: President Trump says he plans to issue an order to 'open up the pumps' and deliver more water from the Sacramento-San Joaquin River Delta to California farms and cities.
444.author: Ian James

445.title: Supreme Court will decide if religious schools may be funded as public charters
445.summary: The Supreme Court agreed to hear a new church-state case that could yield a potentially momentous decision and change the funding of public schools in much of the nation.
445.author: David G. Savage

446.title: Trump revokes the security detail of Dr. Anthony Fauci, who has faced death threats
446.summary: Trump revoked the security for Dr. Anthony Fauci, the infectious disease expert and former advisor turned critic who faces regular threats to his life.
446.author: Associated Press and Times staff

447.title: Cease-fire in Gaza Strip was widely welcomed. It may not last. Here's why
447.summary: Powerful forces in Middle East and, now, in Washington working against truce lasting beyond its first phase.
447.author: Tracy Wilkinson, Laura King

448.title: Opinion: It's now clear that America's death penalty is dying one generation at a time
448.summary: Capital punishment has continued to become rarer in recent years, and public opinion of the practice keeps growing dimmer with time.
448.author: Austin Sarat

449.title: Meet the first couples to wed as Thailand legalizes same-sex marriage
449.summary: Thailand has long been known as a haven for LGBTQ+ communities. It is only the third place in Asia to legalize same-sex marriage, behind Taiwan in 2019 and Nepal in 2023.
449.author: Stephanie Yang

450.title: Trump's rebuke to 'gender ideology' changes federal policy and sets up clash with California
450.summary: The executive order conflicts with laws in California and other blue states that forbid discrimination based on gender identity. The courts are expected to take up the issue.
450.author: David G. Savage

451.title: Under Trump, we could be flying blind when it comes to bird flu, other infectious diseases
451.summary: President Trump announced he's pulling the U.S. from the WHO. Now researchers are scrambling to understand what that means for the H5N1 bird flu pandemic.
451.author: Susanne Rust

452.title: Alawites wary as a post-Assad Syria takes shape
452.summary: Once Syria's most influential minority, Alawites struggle to move on from their association with a hated dictator.
452.author: Nabih Bulos

453.title: U.S. and Australia have long fought fires together. Climate change threatens joint efforts
453.summary: U.S. officials didn't even bother to ask Australia for help battling the Los Angeles fires.
453.author: Max Kim, Maria Petrakis

454.title: Less process than 'a traffic ticket': ACLU sues to stop Trump's fast-track deportation policy
454.summary: ACLU sues to stop Trump policy that allows immediate deportation of some immigrants. The new policy could pave the way for mass expulsions.
454.author: Jessica Garrison, Rachel Uranga

455.title: 'Scare tactic': Bonta slams Trump move targeting local officials over immigration
455.summary: The Department of Justice is planning to investigate and possibly prosecute state and local officials who hinder Trump administration immigration efforts.
455.author: Faith E. Pinho, Keri Blakinger, Ruben Vives

456.title: Calmes: President Trump's Jan. 6 pardons broke his promise to the nation
456.summary: The new/old president seems to have a memory issue. 'You will pay,' he told Jan. 6 lawbreakers in 2021. You're free to go, he said Monday.
456.author: Jackie Calmes

457.title: 'Freaked out': Fear, uncertainty grip California's immigrant community as Trump rolls out crackdown plan
457.summary: Worry spreads over what Trump's orders will mean for California immigrants. One in eight state residents are undocumented or live with a family member who is.
457.author: Ruben Vives, Jessica Garrison, Rachel Uranga, Rebecca Plevin

458.title: Biden, Harris in California, and soon Trump will be too
458.summary: Former President Biden and former First Lady Jill Biden are spending their first days after leaving the White House in Santa Barbara County.
458.author: Seema Mehta

459.title: Musk says his gestures at Trump inauguration event weren't Nazi salutes
459.summary: Musk made the gestures during a giddy speech celebrating Trump's return to power at a rally Monday at Capital One Arena in Washington. Many condemn the gestures, but not the ADL.
459.author: Kevin Rector

460.title: What did Trump's team learn from past legal battles? Immigrant advocates prepare to find out
460.summary: Immigrants rights groups are already contesting President Trump's sweeping executive orders aimed at combating illegal immigration.
460.author: Andrea Castillo

461.title: Mexico's president reacts to Trump moves on immigration, border and cartels. 'It's nothing new'
461.summary: Mexico's President Sheinbaum says she will work with Trump on deportations, border issues and cartels, but laughs at his 'Gulf of America' order.
461.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

462.title: Jan. 6 rioters freed by Trump include Californians and those who assaulted officers
462.summary: Rioters who were convicted and imprisoned for their roles in the violent attack on the Capitol on Jan. 6 were being released after receiving pardons and commutations from Trump.
462.author: Brittny Mejia, Kevin Rector

463.title: Column: How Donald Trump's second inauguration outdid the cruelty and excesses of his first
463.summary: The president freed the Jan. 6 insurrectionists, disparaged California firefighters and welcomed the members of a new American oligarchy to Washington.
463.author: Robin Abcarian

464.title: California, other states sue to block Trump executive order on birthright citizenship
464.summary: California, a coalition of other states and the city of San Francisco have sued the Trump administration over President Trump's executive order aimed at ending birthright citizenship, calling it unconstitutional.
464.author: Kevin Rector

465.title: Sen. Amy Klobuchar says she used her access to nudge Trump on L.A. wildfire recovery
465.summary: Democratic Sen. Amy Klobuchar, the chief of the inaugural transition, acknowledged the difficulty of overseeing the handoff of power to President Trump in the site where his followers sought to violently overturn his election defeat four years ago.
465.author: Seema Mehta

466.title: Trump orders federal agencies to recognize only two sexes that are 'not changeable'
466.summary: President Trump signed executive orders Monday asserting that the U.S. government recognizes only two sexes that are "not changeable," and reversing Biden administration directives on LGBTQ+ rights.
466.author: Emily Alpert Reyes

467.title: 'Drill baby drill': Trump takes aim at clean energy, climate change and the environment on day one
467.summary: In his first day as the 47th U.S. president, Donald Trump took action to reverse many of the Biden administration's efforts to move the country toward a green-energy economy.
467.author: Tony Briscoe, Karen Kaplan

468.title: Trump pledges to restore McKinley's name to tallest peak in North America
468.summary: The pledge to rename Denali was opposed by environmental groups and Alaskan politicians, including Republican U.S. Sen. Lisa Murkowski.
468.author: Lila Seidman

469.title: Trump signs orders to crack down on immigration, send troops to the border
469.summary: President Trump signed executive orders that will fundamentally change how the nation handles immigration, beefing up enforcement and deportations.
469.author: Andrea Castillo, Rachel Uranga

470.title: Column: His first day back in office confirms it — there is no Trump 2.0
470.summary: President Trump promised an inaugural address focused on "unity," but what he delivered was long on promises and anger toward opponents.
470.author: Doyle McManus

471.title: 'We're taking it back.' Trump's comments on the Panama Canal spur pushback from Panama
471.summary: 'We're taking it back.' Trump inauguration speech claim that the U.S. will regain control of the Panama Canal spurs immediate reaction in Panama.
471.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

472.title: Trump immediately flexes presidential powers: 1,500 pardons and a raft of executive orders
472.summary: President Trump flexed his presidential powers Monday, promising executive orders to usher in his agenda. He issued 1,500 pardons, after President Biden issued his own.
472.author: Kevin Rector

473.title: Scenes from a packed Rotunda: Moguls, former presidents — and some notable absences
473.summary: Hundreds of the world's most powerful people — among them every living president as well as billionaire tech executives — were crammed cheek-by-jowl in the 7,200-square-foot Capitol Rotunda.
473.author: Seema Mehta

474.title: Disappointment at border as Trump cancels immigration program
474.summary: The Trump administration cancelled a program aimed at easing the process of applying for asylum, leaving thousands of asylum-seekers disappointed and unsure of what to do next.
474.author: Patrick J. McDonnell

475.title: It's below freezing in D.C., but Trump supporters are thrilled to be present
475.summary: Most people who traveled to Washington to watch the event in person have been relegated to the Capital One Arena, a sports venue nearby, for a livestream of the official ceremony.
475.author: Faith E. Pinho, Seema Mehta, Hailey Branson-Potts

476.title: Opinion: It's time to relearn the lessons of Thomas Paine's 'Common Sense'
476.summary: The revolutionary rallying cry 'Common Sense' — challenging authoritarian rule, countering the sway of the wealthy and upholding the will of the majority — is as relevant in 2025 as it was in 1776.
476.author: A.T. McWilliams

477.title: Marko Elez's exit over 'normalize India hate', rehiring, JD Vance vs Ro Khanna: Here's what happened so far
477.summary: Marko Elez resigned from Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency after his past racist social media posts surfaced. Elon Musk announced that he would rehire him as 'to err is human'. Vice President JD Vance is also in favor of rehiring him about which Democrat Ro Khanna questioned him about his wife and children's Indian connection. Vance slammed Ro for dragging his children while Elon Musk criticized the Wall Street Journal journalist who reported on Marko Elez.
477.author: TOI World Desk

478.title: Donald Trump thinks Prince Harry has enough problems with 'terrible' Meghan Markle. He won't deport him
478.summary: President Donald Trump is not interested in sending Prince Harry out of the country, pursuing his visa case because he thinks the ex-royal already has a lot of problems with his wife Meghan Markle. Trump did not like Harry and Meghan's exit from the royal family as Trump's allegiance lies with the late Queen who Trump said liked him.
478.author: TOI World Desk

479.title: Donald Trump reacts to 'India-hater' Marko Elez's exit from DOGE, says 'whatever JD Vance...'
479.summary: President Donald Trump was asked about controversial DOGE staff Marko Elez who resigned from Elon Musk's team after his past social media posts surfaced. Trump said he was not aware of the specific case but if Vice President JD Vance is in favor of rehiring Elez, then he stands with the vice president.
479.author: TOI World Desk

480.title: 15 minutes to justify 'existence' to 19-year-old DOGE staff: Federal worker recounts 'Elon Musk' experience
480.summary: A video showing a federal worker discussing his experience with Elon Musk has sparked a debate about the treatment of federal employees. The worker revealed that Musk's visit to his agency led to job cuts and intense scrutiny of employees by young, inexperienced staff. The issue was further complicated by accusations of nepotism and internal blockades.
480.author: TOI World Desk

481.title: 'Normalise Indian Hate' Row: Why JD Vance can't stand up for his own wife and kids
481.author: TOI World Desk

482.title: When Melania, Ivanka used USAID funds for their pet projects: 'It's really touching'
482.summary: Records now reveal that both Melania and Ivanka used thousands of dollars from USAID to fund their pet projects during the first term. USAID helped Melania Trump's Be Best program and Ivanka Trump's Women's Global Development and Prosperity Initiative. And they traveled with the agency on separate trips to Africa where they praised the work USAID was doing.
482.author: TOI World Desk

483.title: Prince William’s ‘savage’ comment on Kate’s wardrobe before she became a royal
483.summary: Prince William once made a playful joke about an outfit Kate wore early in their relationship, likening it to clothes from a charity shop. This happened before Kate refined her style to fit her role as a senior royal, which she has since mastered, becoming an international fashion icon.
483.author: TOI World Desk

484.title: Activist arrested for replacing American flag with Mexican flag at California’s park
484.summary: Crystal Aguilar, a 24-year-old activist, was arrested for allegedly replacing an American flag with a Mexican flag at Hart Park in Bakersfield, California. During the confrontation, she threatened park rangers and resisted arrest. Aguilar faces multiple charges, including threatening a peace officer and vandalism, with bail set at $20,689.
484.author: TOI World Desk

485.title: Trump moves to overhaul Kennedy Center, declares himself chairman
485.summary: President Trump has fired several board members from the Kennedy Centre and appointed himself as chairman. Citing previous drag shows as problematic, he promises a new board and programming aligned with his vision. This unprecedented move raises uncertainty about the centre’s future leadership.
485.author: TOI World Desk

486.title: Federal judge blocks Elon Musk-led DOGE from accessing treasury records
486.summary: A federal judge has blocked Elon Musk's department of government efficiency (DOGE) from accessing sensitive treasury records, ruling it illegal. The decision follows a lawsuit by 19 Democratic attorneys general, arguing DOGE's access could lead to illegal actions against federal payments, compromising millions of Americans' financial security.
486.author: TOI World Desk

487.title: ‘To err is human': Musk to rehire employee who resigned after racist remarks
487.summary: Elon Musk reinstated Marko Elez, a former DOGE employee who resigned after being linked to a racist social media account. A poll conducted on Musk's platform, X, showed 78% in favor of rehiring him. US vice president JD Vance supported Elez's return and Musk cited forgiveness in his decision.
487.author: TOI World Desk

488.title: Hamas releases 3 more Israeli hostages as part of ceasefire deal
488.summary: Hamas released three more Israeli hostages, Eli Sharabi, Ohad Ben Ami, and Or Levy, to the Red Cross as part of their ongoing ceasefire agreement with Israel. This marks the fifth exchange since the ceasefire began, bringing the total number of hostages released to 21.
488.author: TOI World Desk

489.title: Pakistan: Opposition marks 'black day' to protest alleged election fraud
489.summary: Pakistan Tehreek-e-Insaf (PTI) Sindh has finalised its plans to mark February 8 as Black Day, protesting what they claim is the theft of their party's mandate, as reported by Express Tribune.

490.title: Trump imposes sanctions on ICC, accuses it of targeting US & Israel

491.title: UK's top feline diplomat comes out of retirement for the 'purr-fect' job

492.title: Immigration policy changes being considered by Trump administration may hit Indians on green card queues hard
492.summary: The Trump administration's potential policy changes, including the revocation of birthright citizenship and employment authorisation documents for H-4 visa holders, raise concerns for Indian H-1B visa professionals. These changes could exacerbate the green card backlog, increase the number of 'aging-out' children, and cause financial instability.
492.author: Ishani Duttagupta

493.title: Kanye West unfollows Taylor Swift, follows Diddy instead, asks Donald Trump to 'free my brother'
493.summary: Kanye West has urged Donald Trump to aid in releasing Sean 'Diddy' Combs, who faces sex trafficking charges and remains in custody. Despite Combs denying the allegations, he awaits trial that may result in a life sentence. This plea comes amid West's own controversies at the 2025 Grammy Awards, driving significant public attention.
493.author: TOI World Desk

494.title: Anger of activists who vandalised Mujib's house understandable: Bangladesh chief adviser Muhammad Yunus

495.title: Alaska lawmakers urge Donald Trump to keep Mt Denali name unchanged
495.summary: The Alaska Legislature passed a resolution urging President Trump to maintain the name Denali for the state's highest peak, emphasizing its cultural and historical significance. The resolution reflects bipartisan support to reject Trump's executive order to restore the name Mount McKinley.
495.author: TOI World Desk

496.title: ‘It's a real thing’: Trudeau warns Canada must take Trump’s annexation talk seriously
496.summary: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau voiced concern over US President Trump's comments about making Canada the 51st state, driven by the country's critical mineral resources. Canada has taken measures to counter potential tariffs, investing in border security and emphasising economic diversification to reduce reliance on the US.
496.author: TOI World Desk

497.title: Hamas says Gaza truce at risk of collapse – AFP
497.summary:
A senior Hamas official has warned that the Gaza ceasefire may collapse, accusing Israel of not fulfilling its commitments

717.title: After years of conflict, Timor-Leste turns peacemaker
717.summary:
During the turbulent early years of Timor-Leste’s independence, the UN was a constant presence, helping to maintain peace and stability. Twenty-four years on, the country has made the successful transition from a host nation for UN peacekeeping operations, to one that contributes to supporting missions elsewhere.

Read the full story, “After years of conflict, Timor-Leste turns peacemaker”, on globalissues.org →

718.title: Online Education: A Lifeline for Afghan Girls Amid Taliban Restrictions
718.summary:
Feb 07 (IPS) - Since the Taliban regained power in Afghanistan in 2021, girls and women have been systematically banned from education, making Afghanistan the only country in the world that denies schooling to girls over the age of 12. The situation continues to deteriorate, with even primary school enrollment for girls in decline, according to UNESCO.

Read the full story, “Online Education: A Lifeline for Afghan Girls Amid Taliban Restrictions”, on globalissues.org →

719.title: Belarus: A Sham Election That Fools No One
719.summary:
LONDON, Feb 07 (IPS) - Alexander Lukashenko will soon begin his seventh term as president of Belarus. The official result of the 26 January election gave him 86.8 per cent of the vote, following an election held in a climate of fear. Only token opposition candidates were allowed, most of who came out in support of Lukashenko. Anyone who might have offered a credible challenge is in jail or in exile.

Read the full story, “Belarus: A Sham Election That Fools No One”, on globalissues.org →

720.title: WFP, FAO Warn of the Severity of the Climate Crisis and Food Insecurity
720.summary:
UNITED NATIONS, Feb 07 (IPS) - Over the past few years, climate shocks have become more frequent and have devastated economies and agriculture systems, exacerbating widespread malnutrition and hunger. It has become increasingly apparent that the utilization of sustainable agriculture practices and disaster risk management systems are crucial to fulfill growing needs as natural resources continue to dwindle.

Read the full story, “WFP, FAO Warn of the Severity of the Climate Crisis and Food Insecurity”, on globalissues.org →

721.title: Forcing Palestinians Out of Gaza is A Recipe for Unimaginable Disaster

722.title: Tanzanians with HIV Left in Crisis as USAID Funding Ends
722.summary:
DAR ES SALAAM, Feb 07 (IPS) - At 9 a.m. on Monday, Mariam Msemwa clutched her clinic card tightly as she stood in line at Bagamoyo District Hospital’s HIV Clinic in Tanzania’s coastal region. The 19-year-old had been here many times before, picking up monthly doses of antiretroviral (ARV) drugs that kept her alive. But today was different. When she reached the counter, the nurse flatly told her. “There’s no more free medication, ” she said. “You’ll have to buy it yourself.”

Read the full story, “Tanzanians with HIV Left in Crisis as USAID Funding Ends”, on globalissues.org →
